skill.name: dispatching-parallel-agents
skill.description: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential dependencies
skill.summary: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential depend...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill with no executable code. All 21 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying markdown syntax and JSON metadata. Contains only a single SKILL.md file with 181 lines of methodological guidance for parallel agent dispatching.

content.user_title: Dispatch parallel agents for independent tasks
content.value_statement: Investigating multiple independent failures sequentially wastes time. This skill provides a pattern for dispatching multiple agents in parallel to solve related problems concurrently.
actual_capabilities: Identify independent problem domains from test failures
Structure focused agent prompts with clear scope and goals
Dispatch multiple agents to work concurrently
Review and integrate parallel agent results
Recognize when NOT to use parallel dispatch
Avoid common mistakes in agent task definitions
limitations: Requires independent tasks with no shared state
Does not apply to related failures that may share root causes
Not suitable when full system context is needed
Cannot handle exploratory debugging where scope is unknown

use_cases.title: Debug multiple test files
use_cases.description: Fix 3+ test files failing with different root causes by dispatching one agent per file

use_cases.title: Investigate subsystem failures
use_cases.description: Diagnose issues across multiple independent subsystems concurrently

use_cases.title: Parallel bug investigation
use_cases.description: Investigate different bugs across unrelated modules at the same time

prompt_templates.title: Basic parallel dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the failing tests in file A while another agent fixes file B. Report back what you found and fixed.

prompt_templates.title: Focused agent scope
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the 3 timing issues in src/agents/abort.test.ts. Focus on replacing arbitrary timeouts with event-based waiting. Return a summary of root cause and changes.

prompt_templates.title: Constrained agent behavior
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix only the batch-completion test failures. Do NOT change production code. Report what you found and what you fixed.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel integration review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these 3 agent summaries. Check for conflicts between the changes. Run the full test suite and report pass/fail status.

output_examples.input: We have 6 test failures across 3 files. What should we do?
output: Identify independent domains: abort.test.ts (timing issues), batch-completion.test.ts (tools not executing), race-conditions.test.ts (execution count = 0)
Dispatch 3 agents in parallel, one per file
Each agent provides focused scope, clear goals, and expected output
Review summaries, check for conflicts, integrate all changes
Result: 3 problems solved in time of 1

output_examples.input: Our CI pipeline shows failures in 4 different subsystems. How can parallel agents help?
output: Analyze each subsystem failure for shared state or dependencies
Dispatch one agent per independent subsystem with specific scope
Agents work concurrently, reducing investigation time
Integrate findings and verify all fixes pass together

best_practices: Group failures by independent problem domains before dispatching
Give each agent specific scope with clear, measurable goals
Define constraints to prevent agents from overreaching their task
Require agents to return summaries of root causes and specific changes
anti_patterns: Assigning 'fix all tests' - agents get lost without focused scope
Providing no context like 'fix the race condition' without file paths
Missing constraints - agents may refactor unrelated code
Vague output expectations like 'fix it' without requiring a summary

faq.question: What qualifies as an independent task?
faq.answer: Tasks that can be understood and solved without context from other tasks, with no shared state between them.

faq.question: How many agents can I dispatch in parallel?
faq.answer: Claude Code supports dispatching multiple agents. Consider system resources and task complexity when deciding.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, use it with any workflow involving multiple independent problems like debugging, refactoring, or testing.

faq.question: Is my data safe with parallel agents?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. Agents run within your Claude Code environment with your configured permissions.

faq.question: What if agents make conflicting changes?
faq.answer: Review summaries before integration. Run full test suite. Spot check agent work for systematic errors.

faq.question: How is this different from sequential agent use?
faq.answer: Parallel dispatch solves multiple independent problems simultaneously instead of one after another, saving significant time.
